summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from a correctional officer detailing the response and procedures following Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It documents the timeline of events from the discovery of Epstein's remains at the hospital through their transport to the city morgue.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose remains are being handled and transported from New York Presbyterian Hospital to the city morgue.

persons.name: Wiggins
persons.role: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner
persons.context: The Director of the Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME) who is communicated with regarding the receipt and transport of Epstein's remains to the city morgue.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Operations Lieutenant who requested the emergency hospital detail response.

connections.description: Wiggins, as Director of the Office of City Medical Examiner, is responsible for receiving and handling Epstein's remains.

events.title: Epstein's Death and Remains Transport
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found deceased at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. His remains are at New York Presbyterian Hospital and are subsequently prepared, secured, and transported to the city morgue under the direction of the Institution Duty Officer and in coordination with the Office of the City Medical Examiner.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased on the morning of August 10, 2019.
His remains were initially at New York Presbyterian Hospital in room A9 of the emergency room.
The Institution Duty Officer (IDO) coordinated with Director Wiggins of the Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME) for the transport of the remains.
Epstein's remains were transported from the hospital to the city morgue at approximately 12:57 PM.
The document is a formal institutional record of the immediate post-death procedures and chain of custody for Epstein's body.
